Issues.Body:

Fixes #8827

Issues.Title: Designer should only allow valid characters in control names.
Issues.Body:
### Background and motivation

When using WinForms Designer UI to create controls especially DataGridViewColumns (where error has bigger impact), invalid characters should not be allowed in the Name field, especially spaces or names that exceed the maximum number of characters allowed this is most important for paste.

Roslyn has functions to validate characters in name and Max length by language, and they or something similar is already being used to validate the Name. Manual entry or paste should do something because otherwise the error does not happen until you try to leave the field or save.

If you are not going to stop the error from happening by only allowing valid characters, there are 2 options for the error dialog (OK or Cancel), and both do exactly the same thing and why do I need to click on details to see it, that information should just appear telling exactly what character(s) is invalid.

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/12789369/3a7eaa38-febb-4225-842f-487a0b502d38)

Specifically, for DataGridViewColumns the Name and Header Text are Typically the same with possibly some information before or after, for example:
Header Name  = "Record Number"
Column Name might be ColumnRecordNumber or RecordNumber or RecordNumberColumn,  I would just be able to paste "Record Number" before, after or over the default Name. with or without the " and with the space.


### API Proposal

N/A

### API Usage

N/A

### Alternative Designs

Improve error to explain what is wrong.

### Risks

Minimal, Roslyn also has all this code and you can just call it for key validation or Paste.

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

This is a designer feature request to improve naming of controls.
It might help accessibility, if invalid characters are not allowed.
No it should be invisible to UI assuming invalid characters are just ignored.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Designer should only allow valid characters in control names." (#11096)

Issues.Title: In DemoConsole app, all tagPages are empty without controls displayed
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it is a regression issue, last week for Winforms repo testing, we can see controls in tabPages of [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, when running it, all tabPages are empty without controls displayed as following:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/874eb25f-bc0e-4926-8a60-14e92744111b





### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "In DemoConsole app, all tagPages are empty without controls displayed" (#11095)

Issues.Title: Unify IPicture usage
Issues.Body:
This moves IPicture related code down to Core and removes the last bit of the old interop from System.Drawing.
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11094)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Unify IPicture usage" (#11094)

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/11083

<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes # 11083


## Proposed changes

-  Changed one line in ToolTip.cs to make sure one variable is not null before using it.
- 
- 

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact
Fixes a rare application crash.

-

- Yes / No
- No unless if you count that it worked in .Net Framework 4.x but not core.

## Risk
No less. Fixes a code assumption where it was passed a nullable value but assumed it was non-null.

Issues.Title: Fixes wrong tooltip when tabbing through PrintPreviewDialog's ToolStripButtons
Issues.Body:
Fixes #10970

## Proposed changes

- Removes changes that seem to have caused the issue.

## Customer Impact

- Tabbing through the controls in the PrintPreviewDialog ToolStripButton's will show proper tooltip even after zoom is altered in the dropdown.

Issues.Title: Pasting from clipboard to MultilineStringEditorUI does not work
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Not tested.

### Issue description

Pasting text from the clipboard into `MultilineStringEditorUI` does not work.  Copy and cut work as they should.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Build and run the [MWA](https://github.com/StuYarrow/MultilineStringEditor.Paste.MWA).
2. Select the text in the TextBox (or any other text).
3. Open the editor for the `MyString` property in the PropertyGrid.
4. Click on the dropdown editor UI to position the cursor.
5. Hit ctrl-v.

Expected result: text is pasted into to the editor.

Actual result: nothing happens.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Pasting from clipboard to MultilineStringEditorUI does not work" (#11084)

Issues.Title: NPE In Unmanaged Code When Pressing Keys In TreeView
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 8.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

My project started in .Net Framework 4.x. I eventually migrated to .Net Core 3.1, then 5.0, 6.0, 7.0 and finally 8.0.
I can't remember exactly when this issue started but it might've been with .net core 3.1.

### Issue description

I have a TreeView control. I also have various keyboard shortcuts which are handled by a MenuStrip.
I've discovered that randomly when I'm using the arrow keys to move around inside the TreeView control, I will get an exception that doesn't contain any user code at all so I'm unable to handle it.
I've found the exact error spot in the source code and even made my own fork that handles the error graceful with one simple line change.
It appears to be attempting to send a ToolTip to the form despite me not having any ToolTips.

Error line in source: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/release/8.0/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ToolTip.cs#L1576
In the source it is calling `tool.GetOwnerWindow()` however this returns a null value and the code seems to be expecting a non-null value.

### Steps to reproduce

I've been unable to reproduce this error in a brand new project. It only occurs on my mature project that originally started out in .Net Framework 4.x.
![Net Issue](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/18266662/20a5fef7-21d5-45aa-b1f8-640afecf3259)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "NPE In Unmanaged Code When Pressing Keys In TreeView" (#11083)

Enable a number of additional code analyzers. One of the more impactful ones here is that we don't want to throw "runtime" exceptions or Exception itself. Changed a number of `Exception` instances to `InvalidOperationException`.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#11080)

Issues.Title: Notifyicon and Windows 11 issues using System.Data.Oledb(8.0.0) library
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

Net 6.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

In Windows 11, when I query an Access database using the System.Data.Oledb library (v.8.0.0) the application name and icon are no longer displayed correctly in the notifyicon as per the attached screenshot. The same program, run in Windows 10 does not give the same problem.
![Notify Icon](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/13166825/95deb604-b42f-47af-9ff8-be80d81f5980)


### Steps to reproduce

[WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/14649217/WinFormsApp1.zip)
Compile and start the attached project and clicking on Show notify
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Notifyicon and Windows 11 issues using System.Data.Oledb(8.0.0) library" (#11078)
